name: LAPD
description: LAPD is a perfectly balanced hybrid named after parent strains, LA Confidential and Purple Diesel. A flavorful medley of sweet grape, earthy pine, and spicy pepper build the complex aroma of LAPD’s compact crimson and purple buds. Small to moderate doses induce a mellow, cerebral euphoria that sinks down to the rest of the body in a full physical calm. According to its breeders at California Bean Bank, LAPD’s abbreviated name appropriately describes these variable effects: “to protect and serve, or to take you out.” LAPD is typically chosen by patients treating pain, cramps, stress, and fatigue. This hybrid grows best in greenhouse gardens using sea or screen of green methods, with a flowering time of 50 to 60 days.
descriptionPlain: LAPD is a perfectly balanced hybrid named after parent strains, LA Confidential and Purple Diesel. A flavorful medley of sweet grape, earthy pine, and spicy pepper build the complex aroma of LAPD’s compact crimson and purple buds. Small to moderate doses induce a mellow, cerebral euphoria that sinks down to the rest of the body in a full physical calm. According to its breeders at California Bean Bank, LAPD’s abbreviated name appropriately describes these variable effects: “to protect and serve, or to take you out.” LAPD is typically chosen by patients treating pain, cramps, stress, and fatigue. This hybrid grows best in greenhouse gardens using sea or screen of green methods, with a flowering time of 50 to 60 days.

highlightedReviews.text: Some of the best stuff I've had. thisbis a perfect sativa if you don't wanna come down any time soon. I'm going to be making brownies soon so I'll post another review of those as well, but I love this dank,  strong smelling medicine. very good. not displeased one bit
Best bud I've had so far

articles.title: New Strains Alert: LAPD, Orange Haze, Tahoe OG Kush, and Tres Dawg
articles.author: Bailey Rahn
articles.text:
Hybridized strains have flooded the cannabis market over the past few decades, bringing us unlimited variety that Leafly will always celebrate. Beginning in the 1970s, growers scoured nature for indigenous cannabis varieties known as landrace strains. These original genetics would give rise to the vast collection of strains we see on dispensary shelves today. We realize many of you prefer the pure indicas and sativas, but we’ve added four new strains for the hybrid lovers out there. 
Are these strains old news to you? Leave a review and tell us what you thought about them!
1. LAPD
Characteristics of LAPD:

50/50 hybrid
Also known as LA Confidential Purple Diesel
Cross between LA Confidential and Purple Diesel
Grape, pine, and pepper aroma
Effects can include mellow, cerebral euphoria and physical calm
Commonly used for pain, cramps, stress, and fatigue
Flowers in 50 to 60 days

2. Orange Haze
Characteristics of Orange Haze:

65% sativa-dominant hybrid
Cross between Orange Bud and Haze
Breeder: Green Devil Genetics
Citrus aroma
Effects can include energy, focus, euphoria, and creativity
Flowers in 64 days

3. Tahoe OG Kush
Characteristics of Tahoe OG Kush:

60% sativa-dominant hybrid
Cross between Tahoe OG and SFV OG Kush
Breeder: Cali Connection
Lemon aroma
Effects can include relaxing, calming effects
Typically used to treat chronic pain, insomnia, and stress
Flowers in 70 days

4. Tres Dawg
Characteristics of Tres Dawg:

Hybrid strain
Cross between Afghani #1 and Chemdawg
Breeder: Top Dawg Seeds
